Found a solution for the ones with out of range[atm only me]:

Right click your desktop shortcut and edit the line "Target" by adding  -windowed after the whole line
Example: "E:GamesSpec Ops The LineBinariesWin32SpecOpsTheLine.exe" -windowed

Below this we can see a "Run" line,edit that to windowed.The game is going to open now and we can change the resolution as we please.

http://gameinfocenter.com/pc-games/system-requirements/Spec-Ops-The-Line.html

Minimum system requirements

OS: Windows XP SP3
Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo @ 2Ghz / AMD Athlon 64 X2 equivalent
Memory: 2 GB RAM
Hard Disk Space: 6 GB free
Video Card: NVIDIA GeForce 7900 / ATI Radeon HD 2600XT (256 MB memory)
DirectX速: 9.0
Sound: DirectX Compatible

For all of you having resolution problems, do this:
go into: "C:Program Files (x86)2K GamesSpec Ops The LineBinariesWin32".
Send "SpecOpsTheLine.exe" to the desktop (thus creating a shortcut).
Right-click on the shortcut, then select "Properties".
In the "destination" field, add "-windowed" (without the quotes) at the end of the string, it should look like this:

"C:Program Files (x86)2K GamesSpec Ops The LineBinariesWin32SpecOpsTheLine.exe" -windowed

Run the shortcut, go into options, change the resolution to fit your needs.
